did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, RG 5 Program Files, Subgroup Grant Files

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grant admininstration files

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

scopecontent.p: Grant 95-181, $325,000.00, for "Celebrating American Orchestras," a new initiative to showcase American orchestras on "Performance Today." A daily program featuring recent live concerts recordings of ensembles and repertoire from all over the U.S. and abroad. They are interwoven with timely news stories about classical music, reviews of new recordings, interviews with musicians, commentary and updates on the field. Broadcast nationally on 179 public radio stations, "Performance Today", is the nation's "most listened-to" classical music program, reaching more than a million listeners each week.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grant 93-247, $2,000,000.00, to assist in funding ('93-'95) a $31.5 million project to implement the Dade County Community Homeless Plan. A newly enacted public funding source (the Food & Beverage Tax) is expected to provide $20.5 million of the three year costs and the private sector (with some help from Municipalities) will need to raise $11.0 million. Dade County's unique plan to serve the Homeless could become a national model. Note: 7/12 Organization name change from Community Partnership for Homeless to Chapman Partnership.

The city's five largest housing projects where 669 families live are located here. 73% of these families earn less than $6,000 a year. STAR Tutors and Readers was begun in 1986 in the belief that improving literacy skills would improve the employability of neighborhood residents, strengthen their ability to participate more fully in society and strengthen family life.

did.unittitle: Internews Network, 20050027 - Emergency Broadcasting: A Rapid Response Communications System for Aceh Disaster Relief

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Written on back: "On December 26, 2004, an earthquake and tsunami devastated Aceh in North Sumatra. The disaster created over 500,000 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs). At the same time, it devastated most of Aceh's broadcasting outlets, plunging large swathes of the population into an information vacuum.

Within weeks of the tsunami, Internews assembled a team of Indonesian and international staff to bring immediate assistance to the media and Aceh. The team found out that the recovery effort in Aceh lacked locally relevant information flow between citizens, organizations, and government agencies.

Internews' Aceh Emergency Broadcasting project is a rapid response information service for the people of tsunami-ravaged Aceh, using radio and effective technologies to get urgent survival information to the over 4 million residents of Aceh and 500,000 IDPs.
Internews has worked with local media in Indonesia for more than seven years, in work ranging from radio and TV production to conflict reporting and journalism training."
